words.etymology_text: From Swahili Uganda (“Buganda, subnational kingdom”), from Luganda Buganda (“land of the Ganda”).

glosses: Ugandan kob, Kobus kob thomasi (subspecies of kob antelope)
Ugandan red colobus, Procolobus tephrosceles (endangered species of red colobus monkey)
state or quality of being Ugandan

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

glosses: Ugric (group of Uralic languages that includes Hungarian, Khanty and Mansi in a seven-category grouping Uralic languages, the others being Finnic, Sami, Mordvin, Mari, Permic and Samoyedic)
the state or quality of bring Ugric

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

words.etymology_text: Internationalism (see German Ugristik). Contains the suffix -iikka.
